data.title: The Effect of Corporate Social Responsibility, Good Corporate Governance, and Capital Structure on Company Value Moderated by Profitability in Technology Sector Companies Listed on the Indonesia Stock
data.text:
Linda Puspita Sari Universitas Pelita Bangsa, Bekasi, Indonesia

Sunita Dasman Universitas Pelita Bangsa, Bekasi, Indonesia

Preatmi Nurastuti Universitas Pelita Bangsa, Bekasi, Indonesia

Keywords: CSR, Good Corporate Governance, Capital Structure, Company Value, Profitability

Abstract

This study aims to examine the impact of Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR), Good Corporate Governance (GCG), and Capital Structure on firm value, moderated by Profitability, in Technology sector companies listed on the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) from 2017 to 2022. The research method utilized SmartPLS application. The findings reveal that CSR, GCG, and Capital Structure do not significantly influence firm value during this period. Furthermore, Profitability neither weakens the effect of CSR nor strengthens the effects of GCG and Capital Structure on firm value, indicating a consistent influence pattern among the examined variables in the main board Technology sector companies. These findings provide important insights that these factors may require different approaches or be influenced by other factors to enhance firm value in the Technology sector.

Downloads

Download data is not yet available.
